Class SchoolLockers

java.lang.Object
SchoolLockers
public class SchoolLockers
extends java.lang.Object
This class models a school which has 100 lockers and 100 students. Initially, the first student, which is denoted as S1, opens every locker. The second student, S2 respectively, begins with the second locker, which is denoted L2, and closes every other locker. S3 begins with the third locker and changes every third locker (closes if it was open, and opens if it was closed) . . . until S100 changes L100
Author:
Mohammad Abdulhussain, Student ID: 991629791

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)  
    static void print​(java.lang.String[] lockers)
    displays all open locker numbers separated by a row for each answer
    static void studentClosedLockers​(java.lang.String[] lockers)
    studentClosedLockers fills the array with the string "CLOSED" Arrays.fill is a method in .Arrays class that assigns the data type to each value in the array
    static void studentLockerChanges​(java.lang.String[] lockers)
    studentLockerChanges changes the string in each element from "CLOSED" to "OPEN" or Vice versa depending on whether the student is S1 .
    static boolean studentLockersOpen​(java.lang.String l)
    studentLockersOpen returns true if l is the string "OPEN", otherwise it returns false

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
